David Howell

About RSS

My favorite part of Instapapering an article from a LinkedIn blog is having the number of recruiter notifications I’m currently ignoring memorialized in the title.

18 May 2018

I love @robinsloan’s take on the game Fortnite & taking a chance on cooperation in a zero-sum space.

Reminds me of Cory Doctorow’s “Weaponized Narrative”: a gesture of cooperation opens a counternarrative to the battle royale.

17 May 2018

I suspect that amateur developers have an easier time of building automation on iOS, in AppleScript, and similar, due to not knowing how comparatively bad the toolchain and development environments are. I love Drafts, for example, but the feedback loop when testing is slow.

16 May 2018

In Conversational Design, Erika Hall frames software as one venue for a customer to engage in conversation with a company providing them with a service. The software should reflect any context the customer shared with a human representative… and vice versa.

15 May 2018

Spreadsheets and scripting languages are optimized for helping a person interactively make sense of a mess – and most of our problems are messes. “Real software” should grow out of the knowledge gained by schlepping through a mess.

14 May 2018

A day out in the sun, then putting my kid to bed… by the time 8 PM rolls around, I’m completely exhausted. This is why I wake up early for me time.

13 May 2018

I love Low-Tech Magazine for looking at technologies not in terms of efficiency, but in terms of the services the technologies provide. “Efficient” implies only one direction for progress, but there are also gains in giving up net-harmful services.

12 May 2018

What I’ve learned today: the price elasticity of demand is a measure of how demand for a good changes in response to changes in its price. A Veblen good is one where demand goes up as the price increases, because signalling that you can afford it is the point.

11 May 2018

I reserved a username with the Eco currency today. After reading the design proposal, it seems like the first cryptocurrency open to the existing value in institutional trust. It probably looks like a waste of time to purists – and that is why I’m interested.

10 May 2018

If I understand Markov chain Monte Carlo methods correctly, they tell us – given a plausible model of the world – what values of parameters produce the greatest number of histories compatible with what actually happened?

09 May 2018

Different communities of practice use different ways of saying similar things. To cultivate better listening, unpack the assumptions behind the words rather than interpreting the words in your pre-existing frame of reference.

08 May 2018

An “echo chamber” forms from weaponizing ad hominem attacks, as opposed to the selection bias that leads to filter bubbles. I would love to see Nicky Case’s simulation of knowledge transmission through crowds extended to model trained distrust and the rebound effects.

07 May 2018

Ordered my first issue of Mortise & Tenon, not because I am a carpenter (I am not), but just for love of gorgeous material things going against the grain of production in 2018.

06 May 2018

Software developers learn to navigate by aesthetics as a proxy for quality, but if we optimize for aesthetics too early, we kill our throughput of learning. Embrace ugly scaffolding where it de-risks experimentation.

05 May 2018

In person, the involuntary body language of peers does at least some of the work (thought not all) of inhibiting racist/sexist language. Online, disapproval has a higher transaction cost. Online communities need explicit codes of conduct for parity.

04 May 2018

Sarah Mei addressed how pair programming and dogmatic adherence to agile practices make work challenging for heterogeneous teams. Although her examples touched on race and gender, what she said also applies to introverts.

Like accessibility, feminism is for everyone.

02 May 2018

Craig Mod:

I’ve come to think of tools as granters of permission.

This is a great heuristic. When a tool sufficiently lowers transaction costs, you can accelerate a frivolous use until something qualitatively new emerges from abundance.

01 May 2018

“when you build a thing [you] must also repair the world around it” -A Pattern Language
